AttackerCapabilities: Ability to set up a server and listen for incoming connections

Vulnerabilities: Lack of input sanitization on the /report page
Lack of access controls on the /admin page
SecurityMeasures: Server-side validation and sanitization of user inputs

Steps.Description: Exploit the XSS vulnerability on the /post page to execute arbitrary JavaScript code on the target's browser.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to perform a cross-site scripting attack to execute malicious code on the target's browser.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker crafts an HTML img tag with an onerror attribute that redirects the browser to a specified URL with the victim's cookie.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully executes the JavaScript code on the target's browser, and the victim's cookie is sent to the specified URL.

Steps.Description: Send the captured cookie to the administrator using the /report page.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to send the captured cookie to the administrator to gain access to privileged information or functionality.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker sends the captured cookie to the administrator via the /report page.
StepDetails.Result: The administrator receives the captured cookie.

Steps.Description: Use the captured cookie to access the /admin page and retrieve the flag.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker wants to use the captured cookie to impersonate the administrator and gain access to the /admin page.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker sends an HTTP GET request to the /admin page with the captured cookie.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully accesses the /admin page and retrieves the flag.
